Installing Home Assistant Core 2022.11.3 on Raspberry Pi 3B+ step by step

Host Operation System

root@raspberrypi:~# cat /etc/os-release
PRETTY_NAME="Raspbian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye)"
NAME="Raspbian GNU/Linux"
VERSION_ID="11"
VERSION="11 (bullseye)"
VERSION_CODENAME=bullseye
ID=raspbian
ID_LIKE=debian
HOME_URL="http://www.raspbian.org/"
SUPPORT_URL="http://www.raspbian.org/RaspbianForums"
BUG_REPORT_URL="http://www.raspbian.org/RaspbianBugs"

 

Install Home Assistant Core

 

run the commands below one by one

sudo apt-get update

sudo apt-get upgrade -y

#Restart the system

sudo reboot

 

#Add an account

sudo useradd -rm homeassistant20221103 -G dialout,gpio,i2c

#create a directory for the installation of Home Assistant Core

sudo mkdir /srv/homeassistant20221103

#change the owner to the homeassistant20221102 account
sudo chown homeassistant20221103:homeassistant20221103  /srv/homeassistant20221103

 

sudo -u homeassistant20221103 -H -s

cd /srv/homeassistant20221103

#create the virtual environment

python3.9 -m venv .

#active the virtual environment

source bin/activate


#Upgrade to the latest pip
pip install --upgrade pip

#install a required Python package

python3 -m pip install wheel


#Install homeassistant  core
pip3 install homeassistant

 

sudo apt autoremove

Trobleshooting

ERROR: Failed building wheel for cryptography

#install Rust

curl https://sh.rustup.rs -sSf | sh

pip3 install pyOpenSSL --upgrade
